alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:50AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central St. Bernard, southeastern St. Charles, east central Lafourche, central Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 215 AM CST... At 150 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barataria, or 13 miles south of Marrero, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belle Chasse, Jean Lafitte, Myrtle Grove, Lafitte, Barataria, Poydras, Violet, Woodmere and Estelle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard
